meanings.definition: To flow or fall in drops or in a thin stream.
meanings.sent1: Water trickles down the rocks in the stream.
meanings.sent2: The rain trickles gently on the windowpane.
meanings.sent3: The leaky faucet trickles all night, making a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent4: Time trickles away like sand through an hourglass.
meanings.sent5: Her tears trickles silently down her cheeks, reflecting her sadness.

meanings.sent1: The tiny trickle of water from the hose was not enough to water the garden.
meanings.sent2: I heard a soft trickle as the water flowed from the fountain.
meanings.sent3: The trickle of juice from the fruit was surprisingly sweet.
meanings.sent4: The trickle of information about the project was enough to keep us interested.
meanings.sent5: The trickle of coins into the charity box warmed her heart.
